Package com.ansi.scilla.web.common.utils

Class AnsiURL

java.lang.Object
com.ansi.scilla.common.ApplicationObject
com.ansi.scilla.web.common.utils.ApplicationWebObject
com.ansi.scilla.web.common.utils.AnsiURL
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class AnsiURL
extends ApplicationWebObject
Parses a "standard" url following the pattern:
/installation/realm/command/filter1/filter2?parm1=value1&parm2=value2
where installation is determined by the deployment paradigm, "realm" is the servlet we're working with (like "division" or "ticket"). The command will either be a numeric database keyfield or a command like "list" or "add". Filters are optional, and are servlet-specific. Query String parameters are also optional and servlet-specific. Both are parsed, but not validated. Note that posted values (like the JSON in an "ADD") must be processed before invoking the constructor.
Author:
dclewis
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • AnsiURL

      public AnsiURL​(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, java.lang.String expectedRealm, java.lang.String[] expectedCommandList) throws ResourceNotFoundException
      Parse the URI from the given request. Note that posted values (like the JSON in and "ADD") must be processed before invoking this constructor
      Parameters:
      request - The unchanged HTTP request object, after posted values are processed
      expectedRealm - Typically the servlet name, eg "ticket" or "division"
      expectedCommandList - A list of valid commands like "list" or "add". A null value means no commands are accepted
      Throws:
      ResourceNotFoundException - Thrown if the realm is incorrect or the URI format is wrong, or if the command does not validate against the list of expected values.

    • AnsiURL

      ResourceNotFoundException
